concept.title: Stylus pop-up menu API
concept.shortdesc: The Stylus pop-up menu API is used for displaying commands in a context menu the user can access by tapping an item on the device screen.

fig.title: Stylus pop-up menu displayed in a preview pop-up

conbody.p: A stylus pop up menu (CAknStylusPopUpMenu, defined in AknStylusPopUpMenu.h) is a floating menu component that contains stylus-specific menu content. As the name implies, the stylus pop up menu is meant to be used only with the stylus by tapping a stylus interactive area. The pop-up menu is displayed near the tapping position.
It is the applicationâ€™s responsibility to create the stylus pop up menu and handle the actions its menu items trigger.
For look and feel guidelines on the stylus pop-up menu, see the stylus pop-up menu UI component description.
For implementation information, see Displaying commands in a context menu.
For the Stylus pop-up menu API classes and header files, see Classes and Definitions.

section.title: Constraints
section.p: This API is valid for touch-enabled Symbian platforms.

section.title: Emulator support
section.p: This API is fully supported in the WINS/WINSCW emulator environment.
